articles.title: Hamas accuses Israel of ceasefire breaches ahead of next hostage-for-prisoner exchange

articles.author: Steve Holland
articles.description: The sanctions include freezing any U.S. assets of those designated and barring them and their families from visiting the United States.
articles.title: Trump imposes sanctions on International Criminal Court

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. has warned of possible sanctions against Rwandan and Congolese officials ahead of a summit meant to address the escalating conflict in eastern Congo, according to a diplomatic note seen by Reuters on Friday.
articles.title: Exclusive: US warns of sanctions against Rwandan and Congolese officials over conflict

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, David Brunnstrom
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump meets Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba for the first time on Friday as two allies wary of China's rise work to boost business and security ties while an escalating trade war threatens to rupture the global economy.
articles.title: Trump meets Japan's Ishiba as China trade war simmers

articles.author: Nivedita Balu
articles.description: Canada could face long-term political challenges with the United States even if it manages to avert U.S. President Donald Trump's threat of tariffs, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said on Friday.
articles.title: Canada could face long-term political challenges with US, says Trudeau

articles.author: Andrei Khalip
articles.description: Three senior members of Portugal's far-right Chega party have in the past two weeks faced accusations of committing a crime, threatening the "law-and-order" image that helped Chega become the third-largest force in parliament.
articles.title: Portugal's far-right Chega hit by allegations against three members

articles.author: Lydia Morrish
articles.description: Several major news outlets including Politico and the Associated Press have rejected unsubstantiated accusations by President Donald Trump and right-wing influencers that the U.S. Agency for International Development paid millions of taxpayer dollars to newsrooms in exchange for coverage favoring the Democratic Party.
articles.title: News outlets reject Trump accusations of USAID media 'payoff'

articles.author: Dawoud Abu Alkas
articles.description: Palestinians in Gaza say they are determined to rebuild their own seafront restaurants and hotels, dismissing U.S. President Donald Trump's vision of creating a "Riviera of the Middle East" emptied of its population and under U.S. control.
articles.title: Gazans tell Trump they will rebuild their own restaurants and hotels

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian police have opened a criminal investigation into an alleged assault on a freelance journalist by a person believed to be an employee of the British embassy, the Russian interior ministry said on Friday.
articles.title: Russia opens criminal case over alleged assault involving British embassy employee

articles.author: Jaimi Dowdell, Lena Masri, Giulia Paravicini, Ryan Mcneill, Nafisa Eltahir
articles.description: The Trump administration’s effort to slash and reshape American foreign aid is crippling the intricate global system that aims to prevent and respond to famine.
articles.title: Halt in U.S. aid cripples global efforts to relieve hunger
